    • Field Detail

      • EP_NAME

        public static final ExtensionPointName<ToolWindowEP> EP_NAME

      • id

        public java.lang.String id

      • anchor

        public java.lang.String anchor
        The side of the screen on which the toolwindow is displayed ("left", "right" or "bottom").

      • side

        public boolean side

      • icon

        public java.lang.String icon
        The resource path of the icon displayed on the toolwindow button. Toolwindow icons must have the size of 13x13 pixels.

      • isDoNotActivateOnStart

        public boolean isDoNotActivateOnStart
        Tool window saves its state on project close and restore on when project opens. In some cases, it is useful to postpone its activation until the user explicitly activates it. Example: Tool Window initialization takes a huge amount of time and makes project loading slower. true if Tool Window should not be activated on start even if was opened previously. false otherwise. Please note that active (visible and focused) tool window would be activated on start in any case.

      • factoryClass

        public java.lang.String factoryClass
        The name of the class implementing ToolWindowFactory, used to create the toolwindow contents.

      • getPluginDescriptor

      • setPluginDescriptor

        public final void setPluginDescriptor(PluginDescriptor value)
        Description copied from interface: PluginAware
        Called by extensions framework when extension is loaded from plugin.xml descriptor.

        If this method is implemented in a bean class extension point and it also exposes the stored plugin description via getPluginDescriptor method, you must annotate the latter with @Transient to ensure that serialization engine won't try to deserialize this property.

        Specified by:
        setPluginDescriptor in interface PluginAware
        Parameters:
        value - descriptor of the plugin that provided this particular extension.
